iep_goals: Read grade-level text with 85% accuracy and demonstrate comprehension through written responses in 4 out of 5 trials
Complete multi-step math problems involving fractions and decimals with 70% accuracy in 3 out of 4 trials
Develop emotional regulation strategies through counseling sessions with 85% success rate
Independently organize materials and assignments using visual schedules with 90% success rate
Produce /s/ and /z/ sounds in conversational speech with 75% accuracy across 5 conversation exchanges
Use appropriate volume and tone during classroom discussions in 8 out of 10 opportunities
accommodations: Extended time (1.5x) for assignments and assessments (Across all instructional environments)
Preferential seating-away from distractions (Across all instructional environments)
Use of graphic organizers for writing tasks (GEN ED/SSC)
Simplified and shortened assignments when appropriate (GEN ED/SSC)
Modified ELA testing with extended time
Modified Math testing with calculator permitted
Testing accommodations for Science and Social Studies
access to bilingual dictionary and translation tools
small group instruction three times a week for 45 minutes
peer buddy system for social interactions
learning_styles: works well in structured, predictable environments
placement: 85% time in regular class & extracurricular & non academic activities, 15% time outside regular class

interviews.parent: Parent reported student is bilingual (Spanish/English) and experiences anxiety in new situations. Lives with mother and two younger siblings.
interviews.teacher: Student shows strong effort but struggles with reading comprehension and math concepts. Benefits from visual supports and peer interaction.

observations.psychologist: Student demonstrates appropriate social skills but shows signs of test anxiety. Responds well to encouragement and structured activities.
